title: Soldat Souliote [Souliote soldier]
credit_line: Gift of Dr. and Mrs. Daniel Fishkoff
provenance_text:
Achille-Jacques-Jean-Marie Devéria [1800-1857], Paris, France; given by the artist to Washington [1]. Seiferheld and Co., New York, NY [2]; Dr. and Mrs. Daniel Fishkoff, Colonia, NJ, by June 12, 1974 until December 11, 1975 [3]; their gift to Museum of Art, Carnegie Institute, Pittsburgh, PA, December 1975.

Notes:
[1]. Unidentified friend of the artist, as per inscription on drawing.
[2]. See copy of verso of photograph of the drawing form the Frick Art Reference Library Photoarchive; it contains the New York gallery's label. The photograph was donated to the Frick Library on May 23, 1974 by Mrs. (Helene) Muensterberger, an owner of the gallery.
[3]. Several other works in the Fishkoff collection have also passed through the Seiferheld gallery in NYC, which was active throughout the 1960s under various names. Daniel and Jane Fishkoff loaned the drawing to the Museum of Art, Carnegie Institute in June 1974; see curatorial file for original loan form and list of works. The drawing was accessioned on December 11, 1975.
